intro: Ichnanthus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in moist soils. Ichnanthus attenuatus plays a vital role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
